intro: Coffea sapinii, commonly known as the Sierra Leone coffee. It is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family, native to tropical regions of West Africa. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves and produces small, red berries containing the seeds used for coffee. It thrives in shaded, humid environments and requires well-drained soil. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
